comments.commentBody:
Liberals are desperate? Which party has a nominee who is unable to control what flows from his brain to his mouth? And which party has tried to pass laws that are against the Constitution in that they allow discrimination against people who may be part of the LGBTQ community because it could offend a business owners religious beliefs? And who is it that keeps on saying climate change isn't happening in spite of evidence saying it is? And let's not forget who shut down the government.

Richard Luettgen, if you want to know which party is in trouble it's the red neck party of useless prattlers, also known as the GOP. And liberal, while used as a pejorative by many could be applied to the GOP. They are very liberal in their prejudices, intrusiveness into women's reproductive lives, worship of the NRA, and subservience to their rich donors. The Republicans of today do not care about the average American. The fact that a Donald Trump ever made it to the point of being their nominee shows how far the GOP has fallen. My one hope is that it falls further so that it has to either collapse completely or regroup and accept that not everyone is the 1%.

It's extremely difficult to speculate which modern religion, if any, may answer this question. First, similar to the United States Constitution, you cannot (or should not) look in total to the founding fathers or in this case founding Father for uncontested guidance. The Father in question might even be retired or dead. Therefore, Jesus, today, probably could not (or should not) rely upon a traditional, personal God to direct his way. Moreover, I don't think Buddha's way fills the quest--too much personal, possibly self-interest, in the search for individual "unconditional happiness." Having faith/belief in science, beyond the material world, doesn't accomplish much either so I don't suggest that direction for him. Possibly he might step into the uncertainty--more accurately the confusion of philosophical reasoning but beware of false ideas. There's the "golden rule" which I strongly recommend. Further, I saw a quote by literary critic Harold Bloom offering much wisdom. He said: " Only dualism, the distinction between Ideal forms and ordinary realities, is truth for Plato's Socrates." In short, maybe one has to return to the spoken words of each Jesus and Socrates for help and direction.

That's right - Jesus was a Jew, and I've seen it said that all of his authentic sayings were consistent with the Judaism of his time, which is not identical with the Judaism of today (no Talmud, no rabbinical writings, etc.). The true founder of Christianity was Saul of Tarsus, aka St. Paul, and I wonder what Jesus would have thought of some of Paul's teachings.

The message of religion is a moral one, that we should treat other people as we ourselves would want to be treated - yes it's just the Golden Rule. But applying it in practice seems to be anything but simple, because it aims to transcend some very deep-seated negative tendencies in human nature: rejecting the outsider, domination of the weak by the strong, "rule or die", etc. So we tend to ignore the message and venerate the messenger instead, meanwhile continuing with the "business as usual" of wealth, strife and idolatry.

.
Hand up for GRAB bag, although on further review, it "fits" less well than SWAG does.

But as I have said, we're just filling boxes, not answering quiz questions. If it were a Q & A SESSION, I'd be asking why the US can't trade Florida, Louisiana, Vermont, any Alaskan who has Sarah Palin's cell number, a body of water replete with fish, and a 2-year campaign to Canada for Justin Trudeau [or his spouse], a campaign of no longer than 11 weeks, and draft picks.

I think a lot of Americans would be happy with Canada's Governor-General, if it relieved us of the endless and unproductive campaign.

Some would be satisfied being governed by the guy who foiled the attempted attack on Parliament.

I would argue your points thusly
1) You say "If the economy is at full capacity, no economist would advocate a deficit spending increase." Fed chairperson Yellen is so convinced the economy is near full capacity she is anxious to raise interest rates. Krugman on the other hand argues for greater fiscal stimulus, beyond Clinton's plan, and partly funded by deficit spending. I readily concede the real argument is over whether the economy is in fact at full capacity. But thus instead of "no economist", it is Krugman and many others advocating.
2) Instead of nobody, I think both Krugman and Sims do in fact argue over the short term effect of deficit spending on inflation and not about debt reduction caused by long term inflation.
3) Normal inflation or moderate inflation over the long term may help working people with debt if and only if their interest are locked in low rates and their salaries keep up with the inflation. Short term higher inflation will nearly hurt the worker because wages don't keep up, and this will offset gains from reduced debt. His leverages asset appreciates, so does the replacement cost. But his reduced real wage remains devalued for years.
Taxes to reduce debt can favor the worker much more than inflation. Inflation is essentially a regressive tax, whereas taxes are progressive.
Since the end of WWII govt debt reduction came from inflation and taxes (60 -40).
I do agree VAT is evil, regressive, and shutter when Krugman endorses.

.
I hope I AM not foRBidden to say there was a syMMetry issue there.

Either the people reviewing the puzzle needed some R&R, or they forgot to BORRow someone to do the necessary Quality Assurance so that we would say "AW" at the wordplay and MM when we were done.

Hillary has been exonerated?
Maybe you should send the FBI an email, because they're still investigating.

Send them an email. Hillary has a private server you can use.

And if you'll notice, the FBI isn't investigating why Trump hasn't disclosed his tax returns. Because there has never been a law in the history of human existence that requires it.

For every news hit on Google for climate change there are 22 million hits for Hillary Clinton's scandals.

I need to repeat this.
People are 22 million times more interested in Hillary's crimes than fake climate change junk science driven attempts to change the news media cycle by desperate liberals.

The FBI criminal investigation of Hillary Clinton is still ongoing.
In the history of the FBI, there has NEVER been a criminal probe or ongoing investigation of someone who has been exonerated.

Since there have been human beings on Earth, the FBI has never continued a criminal investigation of someone who they've "exonerated." Not to mention the fact that the FBI doesn't exonerate people.

So other than the fact that what you are saying has never occurred in the history of the universe, you make very compelling points.

No seriously Obama liberals...
Comey made it very clear: HRC's mistakes did not rise to the level of malicious criminal activity. So her case was treated the same way as if she were any "average Joe."

No. The Bush administration deleted 22 million emails without anyone getting a prison sentence. Bush White House officials used a private and non-secure server (the RNC one) for official correspondence without anyone getting a prison sentence. She did not lie repeatedly or change her story. And your last point is certainly wrong also. This is not just a double standard but a triple and quadruple one. The Clinton haters are every bit as demented and partisan as those who for years claimed that President Obama was magically born in Kenya, and was a Muslim, and the hater who Swiftboated Kerry and the other lies across time.

The FBI said no crime was committed. This was after a year long investigation by 15 to 20 agents. Clinton haters are ignoring the actual evidence and the actual investigation by the country's top law enforcement agency to pursue their witch hunt. Zero evidence and zero crime according to the FBI.

A simple question for Hillary followers out there: What would happen to you folks if indulged in any one of the activities she indulged in?
a) Moving the classified info into her private email server
b) Deleting the information sought by Congress
c) Lying repeatedly and changing her story
d) Offering access to SOS office in lieu of donations to Clinton Foundation

Does a prison sentence sound reasonable?
Trump was not an elected official operating contrary to US Criminal Code, with a decades-long record of mercenary politics.  Find another false equivalence.
By this logic I can go outside and randomly shoot my gun in the air and as long as I don't hit anyone or anything then all is copacetic.

She was not an undercover agent, only one with a false employment cover, and so she could never be "outed," and there was no crime committed.  When Valerie and hubby Joe Wilson were on the cover of Vanity Fair, Valerie's mission of self-promotion was accomplished.
Whatever. The Senate just votes an exemption for themselves. Condi Rice sent no e-mails at all. Which is shadier ?
Based on the FBI's historical neglect and enabling of the 9/11 terror cell, why would anyone trust them?  Not to mention, Ruby Ridge and Waco....

The documents provided a number of new details about Mrs. Clinton’s private server, including what appeared to be a frantic effort by a computer specialist to delete an archive of her emails even after a congressional committee had requested they be preserved.

How is this any different than when Richard Nixon had 18 minutes erased from his tapes? It was called “obstruction of justice” back then. The law has not changed--the corruption of federal government has...
Hillary is only tenable by comparison to Trump's alleged odiousness, Randall says.  Faint praise, indeed.
She really could gut a child with a hacksaw on national TV or in front of you and you'd still defend her?  Would it even make a difference if the child was your own?

That makes no sense. Why would she do that ?

I'm living in the real world, the world of "innocent until proven guilty", and in this world, there wasn't even a charge.

Again, if you think Comey is corrupt and pulling water for Hillary, Obama, and the Democratic party, by all means, write your Congressperson and lay out your rationale for getting a Special Prosecutor to indict him.

You are correct was not prosecuted against she. Is not guilty of a crime yet. However, this woman does not know what classified means, has no memory whatsoever, used her own servers bleached it and you as a thinking person will still vote for her? As inept as she is? That's interesting.

I don't need to know the exhaustive details of her innocence.

The fact is that she was incorrectly referred and ultimately exonerated.

Our guiding principle is "innocent until proven guilty", not "guilty despite being proven innocent".
Jake Tapper reported 13 devices, 2 destroyed by hammers, the 11 others have gone missing.  Nice work, Dynasty.
Yet the FBI is investigating Hillary...NOT Trump.
Showing that "a foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds," especially about climate change, stumbler.
They probably contracted out IT services, decades ago, to the lowest bidder. Like you know, airport security is contracted out. And immigration services.
Be specific, stumbler: how is Trump "definitely worse"?  Facts, for a change.

Actually it was difficult to setup a e-mail server if you actually read the FBI's report and all the steps required in the process.The point is Hillary was SoS with vital info and YES there is information according to William Binney ex-NSA that human intelligence assets in the middle east identities were compromised and uncovered and according to him there lost of life of several.The Iranian nuclear scientist recently executed in Iran was another whom's name had been appearing in Hillary's unsecured e-mail system.

Amen to Andrew H. Perhaps The Times thought that by putting this endless iteration of the email story next to Trump's problems with the RNC, it was being evenhanded. But after so much thoughtful discussion about the inferior nature of that criterion in journalism, shouldn't the focus shift to truth?
